uk.me.m0rjc.picstategenerator.visitor

Interface IModelVisitor

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Pic18AsmBuilder, SimulatorBuilder

    public interface IModelVisitor
    Visitor interface, to build things based on the model. (A visitor/builder cross)
    Author:
    Richard Corfield <m0rjc@m0rjc.me.uk>

      • visitStartCode

        void visitStartCode()
        Declare the start of code. The builder may wish to output any boilerplate code here.

      • startSharedEntryCode

        void startSharedEntryCode(INode node)
        Start rendering commands to run on entering the node at the end of a state transition. Will be followed by visitCommand* followed by a visitTransitionGoToNode
        Parameters:
        node - the node to render shared entry code for.

      • startNode

        void startNode(INode node)
        Start a Node. The Node will be started, all its transitions visited, then the node ended before any other nodes are visited. The first node to be started is the root node.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to start code for.

      • visitTransition

        void visitTransition(Transition transition)
        Visit a Transition on the current Node.
        Parameters:
        rangeTransition -

      • visitTransitionPreconditionGE

        void visitTransitionPreconditionGE(Variable variable,
                                 int value)
        Encode a transition precondition for Greater or Equals. If variable >= value then continue, otherwise if possible pop() or continue to the next transition.

      • visitTransitionPreconditionEQ

        void visitTransitionPreconditionEQ(Variable variable,
                                 int value)
        Encode a transition precondition for Equals. If variable == value then continue, otherwise if possible pop() or continue to the next transition.

      • visitTransitionPreconditionLE

        void visitTransitionPreconditionLE(Variable variable,
                                 int value)
        Encode a transition precondition for Less than or Equals. If variable <= value then continue, otherwise if possible pop() or continue to the next transition.

      • visitTransitionPreconditionFlag

        void visitTransitionPreconditionFlag(Variable flag,
                                   int bit,
                                   boolean expectedValue)
        Encode a precondition checking that the given flag has the given value If flag:bit == expectedValue then continue, otherwise if possible pop() or continue to the next transition.

        void visitCommandSetFlag(Variable flags,
                       int bit,
                       boolean newValue)
        Encode a command to set or clear a flag. If bit is more than 7 then more than one byte is used.

      • finished

        void finished()
        End of visiting

      • push

        void push()
        Enter a sub-block of code. Equivalent to open brace in C. In Assembler a label will be created at the corresponding pop(). The location of that label will be used by the #saveReturnOnStack() method and the exitCodeBlock(int) method.

        This can be used in condition processing to create a decision tree, and in subroutine processing to create the GOSUB command.

        Client code must ensure that all push and pop balance within a transition.

      • saveReturnOnSubroutineStack

        void saveReturnOnSubroutineStack()
        After a push() store the location of the corresponding pop() on the subroutine stack.

        Usage:

         push()
    saveReturnOnSubroutineStack() // Saves LABEL1
    visitTransitionGoToSharedEntryCode(subroutineNode)
 pop() // LABEL1
        See Also:
        GosubCommand

      • exitCodeBlock

        void exitCodeBlock(int levels)
        After a push() GOTO the corresponding POP if levels = 0. If levels is more than 0 then more levels will be exited. This is like the break command in Java and C.

        Examples:

         push()
   exitCodeBlock(0)  // GOTO LABEL1
   push()
     exitCodeBlock(0)   // GOTO LABEL2
     exitCodeBlock(1)   // GOTO LABEL1
   pop()  // LABEL2
 pop()   // LABEL1
        Parameters:
        levels - 0 for the current level, more for greater depths of local code blocks.

      • pop

        void pop()
        Exit a sub-block of code. Equivalent to close brace in Java and C. In Assembler a label will be created, its name determined by the corresponding push().

      • visitTransitionReturnFromSubroutineStack

        void visitTransitionReturnFromSubroutineStack()
        GOTO the location held on the Subroutine Stack. This will have been saved by a previous saveReturnOnSubroutineStack()
